text: The 1961 Los Angeles State Diablos football team represented Los Angeles StateCalifornia State University, Los Angeles (Cal State LA) was known as Los Angeles State College of Applied Arts and Sciences from 1947 to 1963. during the 1961 NCAA College Division football season. Los Angeles State competed in the California Collegiate Athletic Association (CCAA). The team was led by eleventh-year head coach Leonard (Bud) Adams, who had been the leader of the team since the school started playing intercollegiate football in 1951. They finished the season with a record of four wins, four losses and one tie (4–4–1, 2–2–1 CCAA). ==Schedule== ==Team players in the NFL== The following Los Angeles State players were selected in the 1962 NFL Draft. {|class="wikitable" width="65%" |- align="center" style="background:#A81933;color:#FFFFFF;" | Player || Position || Round || Overall || NFL team |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Fred Gillett || Center – Linebacker – Guard || 19 || 261 || Baltimore Colts |} ==Notes== ==References== Los Angeles State Category:Cal State Los Angeles Diablos football seasons Los Angeles State Diablos football
